display=\"inline\"><msqrt><mi>s</mi></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>13</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mi>TeV</mi></math>. The data set corresponds to an integrated luminosity of <math display=\"inline\"><mn>138</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msup><mi>fb</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> collected with the CMS detector at the LHC. Jets originating from energetic <math display=\"inline\"><mi>b</mi></math> hadrons are identified through a <math display=\"inline\"><mi>b</mi></math>-tagging algorithm that utilizes a deep neural network or the presence of a muon inside a jet. The invariant mass spectrum of jet pairs is well described by a smooth parametrization and no evidence for the production of new particles is observed. Upper limits on the production cross section are set for excited <math display=\"inline\"><mi>b</mi></math> quarks and other resonances decaying to dijet final states containing <math display=\"inline\"><mi>b</mi></math> quarks. These limits exclude at 95% confidence level models of <math display=\"inline\"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> bosons with masses from 1.8 TeV to 2.4 TeV and of excited <math display=\"inline\"><mi>b</mi></math> quarks with masses from 1.8 TeV to 4.0 TeV. This is the most stringent exclusion of excited <math display=\"inline\"><mi>b</mi></math> quarks to date.","source":"APS"},{"value":"A search is performed for narrow resonances decaying to final states of two jets, with at least one jet originating from a b quark, in proton-proton collisions at $\\sqrt{s}$ = 13 TeV. The data set corresponds to an integrated luminosity of 138 fb$^{-1}$ collected with the CMS detector at the LHC. Jets originating from energetic b hadrons are identified through a b-tagging algorithm that utilizes a deep neural network or the presence of a muon inside a jet. The invariant mass spectrum of jet pairs is well described by a smooth parametrization and no evidence for the production of new particles is observed. Upper limits on the production cross section are set for excited b quarks and other resonances decaying to dijet final states containing b quarks. These limits exclude at 95% confidence level models of Z' bosons with masses from 1.8 to 2.4 TeV and of excited b quarks with masses from 1.8 to 4.0 TeV.
